newsitem.title: IRAN: Families of Iranian diplomats leave Tirana.
newsitem.headline: Families of Iranian diplomats leave Tirana.

text.p: The families of Iranian diplomats based in Tirana have been evacuated to Greece aboard a Greek frigate, the official Iranian news agency IRNA said.
IRNA late on Sunday quoted Iranian diplomats in Athens as saying 14 Iranians, mostly wives and children of diplomats, were evacuated from the Albanian port of Durres to Corfu in Greece.

"The 14 Iranians were flown to Athens from the Greek island of Corfu where they were evacuated yesterday (Saturday) by a Greek frigate. They are all well but exhausted," IRNA quoted a diplomat as saying.
The Iranian charge d'affaires and other diplomats remained in Tirana, IRNA said.
Unrest erupted across southern Albania in January over the collapse of fraudulent pyramid investment schemes. It spread to most of the country in recent weeks.
